                                                               BoardTiles layout)
        Get the lines created or added to by a single move
        Parameters:
        move - the move for which you want to find the lines
        layout - the board layout for which the lines should be found (mainly used for debugging purposes).
        Returns:
        All the created lines are lines that were added to

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves)
        This is the method that checks if a series of moves is valid. It creates a deep copy of the board layout to test the tiles on. This way moves can be checked without being added to the board. It allso stores the reasin it failed in a errorBuffer so the human player can see why his moves failed in plain text.
        Parameters:
        moves - A list of moves to be checked for correctness.
        Returns:
        either true if the moves are valid

      • getErrors

        public java.lang.String getErrors()
        A getter for a string of errors, allowing the humanPlayer to see why his move was incorrect.
        Returns:

      • getPoints

        public int getPoints(java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves)
        The method to calculate the points generated by a series of moves. This allso uses a deep copy of the tile layout so it can be used for move prediction.
        Parameters:
        moves - the moves to calculate the points for
        Returns:
        the points generated by these moves

      • setField

        public boolean setField(java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves,
                        BoardTiles tileMapToPlace)
        Place the moves on the field This method allows for placing tiles in a copied board so it can be used for deepcopied layouts
        Parameters:
        moves - the moves to place on the field
        tileMapToPlace - the tile layout to use for placing the moves
        Returns:
        returns true if all the moves were valid.

      • setField

        public boolean setField(java.util.ArrayList<Move> moves)
        This method uses the standard layout to place make the moves.
        Parameters:
        moves - the moves to place on the field
        Returns:
        true if all the moves were valid.

      • hasPossibleMoves

        public boolean hasPossibleMoves(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> useTiles)
        This method checks if there is atleast 1 valid move and is mainly used for checking if the game should be ended prematurely
        Parameters:
        useTiles - all the tiles for which to check possible moves
        Returns:
        true if there is atleast one possible move

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.util.ArrayList<Move>,java.lang.Integer> getPossibleMoves(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> useTiles)
        This method calculates every possible move that can be played using the default board and ranks them by the amount of points that would be scored when the move is made.
        Parameters:
        useTiles - The tiles for which to check possible moves
        Returns:
        a list of series of moves, sorted by the scores they can make

      • recursiveMoveCalc

        public java.util.HashMap<java.util.ArrayList<Move>,java.lang.Integer> recursiveMoveCalc(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> useTiles,
                                                                                        java.util.ArrayList<Move> prevMoves,
                                                                                        int direction)
        GetPossibleMoves uses a recursive move calculation to check for any other valid move, once there are no more possible moves it returns a value.
        Parameters:
        useTiles - the that are left from previous moves
        prevMoves - the list of previous moves
        direction - the direction in which the line is looping
        Returns:
